image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'JD Vance is not authentic': Former White house press secretary Jen Psaki slams Republican US VP nominee saying 'voters are not dumb'
item.description: Jen Psaki criticized Republican VP nominee JD Vance for inauthenticity, noting his shift to support Donald Trump. Psaki emphasized Vance's inconsistency, stating voters are smart enough to notice. Recently, Vance's attempt to confront Kamala Harris further highlighted his campaign tactics. Trump announced Vance as his VP pick in July via Truth Social.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Trump's 'Criminals for Kamala' video sparks controversy amid his own legal troubles
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canadian man sues TikTok, Instagram, Facebook for ‘addictive’ design, citing harm to mental health
item.description: A 24-year-old Canadian man launched a lawsuit against TikTok, YouTube, Reddit, Instagram, and Facebook, claiming they create platforms that are too addictive. Represented by Lambert Avocats, he says social media has hurt his productivity and sleep since 2015. The lawsuit seeks compensatory and punitive damages, arguing the companies were negligent in their app design.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘What am I doing?’: Biden appears confused at White House event honoring Texas Rangers; watch video
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan's scientists warn of a 'megaquake': What it means
item.description: Japan's earthquake scientists warned of a potential 'megaquake' in the future, which could cause massive loss of life. The Japan Meteorological Association issued this advisory under new guidelines post the 2011 disasters, cautioning about strong shaking and large tsunamis from the Nankai Trough, a significant subduction zone with past destructive quakes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: First live debate between Harris and Trump announced - Key details
item.description: US vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump faced off in their first live television debate on September 10. This followed Joe Biden’s withdrawal from the race after a dominant Trump performance in their June debate. Recent polls showed Harris leading Trump, boosted by her campaign's nomination of Tim Walz as her running mate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I have always been ... ': Usha Vance reveals truth behind JD Vance’s eyeliner speculation
item.description: Usha Vance, wife of the Republican vice-presidential candidate, clarified the speculation around her husband's notable lashes and striking eyes, confirming they are natural and untouched by cosmetics. Even Donald Trump noticed and praised Vance's appearance. A report from Puck News had previously suggested that his prominent lash line was likely natural.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Renowned crocodile expert Adam Britton jailed for sexually abusing dogs
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US election: Trump’s 2020 praise for Walz's response to Minneapolis riots collides with current criticism
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia accuses UK of instigating and taking part in Ukraine's 'major provocation'
item.description: Russia accused the UK of involvement in Ukraine's attack on Russia's Kursk region. Kyiv's troops, equipped with Western tanks, attacked Russia's Kursk to divert Russian forces. Russia claimed it halted the advance, causing heavy casualties. Recent offensive into Russian territory seems to be carried out by a substantial force of several thousand Ukrainian soldiers. The US approved the operation, citing defensive capabilities against imminent Russian attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tropical storm Debby’s fury: Tornadoes and floods impact homes, schools, and lives
item.description: Tornadoes generated by Tropical Storm Debby caused destruction in North and South Carolina, damaging homes and infrastructure, including Springfield Middle School. One fatality was reported in Lucama, North Carolina. The storm led to significant flooding in both Carolinas and southeastern Georgia. With Debby downgraded to a tropical depression, further rains and flooding were anticipated in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hall of Fame golfer Juan 'Chi Chi' Rodriguez passes away at 88
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine launches unexpected attack inside Russia, shakes up 30-month war in bold move
item.description: Ukrainian forces launched an unexpected attack into Russian territory, surprising Moscow and opening a new front in the conflict. The incursion, involving about 1,000 Ukrainian soldiers, aimed to divert Russian resources and alleviate pressure on Ukrainian forces in the east. Russian officials reported several settlements were seized, prompting a state of emergency in one region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Teen loses life after dairy allergy reaction to Costa Coffee hot chocolate
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro signs decree blocking X access for 10 days
item.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has blocked access to social media platform X for 10 days following a disputed election. Maduro, accusing Elon Musk of inciting unrest, signed a resolution presented by Conatel. Opposition leaders claim the election was fraudulent, leading to protests and calls from international bodies for transparency, while security forces cracked down on demonstrators.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris doesn't back Israel arms embargo, aide says
item.description: Kamala Harris's aide clarified that she does not support an arms embargo on Israel, emphasizing her commitment to ensuring Israel's defense. This stance comes amid pressure from the Democratic left and in the context of her recent interactions with pro-Palestinian protesters. Harris’s position is critical in the battleground state of Michigan, where many oppose the Gaza war.

item.title: Is Trump the reason behind Prince Harry and Meghan's urgency to repair royal ties?
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have been making attempts to reconcile with King Charles due to an anticipated US election. Harry recently visited his father, who is undergoing cancer treatment. Past comments by Trump's son and Harry's visa concerns have added to the desperate. Meghan also has a strained relationship with Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris ahead by 5 points, Donald Trump trails in key swing states, new poll shows
item.description: Democrat Kamala Harris led Republican Donald Trump 42% to 37% in the latest Ipsos poll for the November 5 US presidential election. This marked an increase from a previous survey in July. An independent candidate, Robert Kennedy Jr, saw his support drop from 10% to 4%. Harris also led Trump in seven key states, and voters associated “patriot” more with Trump but “weird” more with Trump too.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Not my child’: Woman’s surrogacy nightmare revealed after DNA test
item.description: A Reddit post revealed a woman’s DNA test showing she is not the biological mother of her 2-year-old son, leading to her discovering her husband's infidelity with the surrogate. Devastated, she decided to divorce her husband and give up parental rights, sparking controversy and discussion around possible legal actions against the surrogate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Feel like a brave soldier': Trump calls avoiding STDs his 'personal Vietnam' in old video
item.description: In a 1997 interview, Donald Trump likened his dating life to a soldier’s experience in the Vietnam War, calling it his 'personal Vietnam' due to the risks of contracting STDs. He claimed his dating exploits deserved the Congressional Medal of Honor. This comparison drew backlash for trivializing the experiences of Vietnam War veterans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
